Success
This code is used by ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} components to indicate the processing is successful.
No action is required.
The waiter is disabled
No action is required
The operation will be completed asynchronously
No action is required
No message is available
No action is required
The requested property was not found
No action is required
The end of the message is reached
Processing has reached the end of the message.
This is commonly an expected situation, but if it is not expected check the application and the message data.
The request failed because a destination is full
A destination queue or subscription has reached its maximum messages and this has caused the requested operation to fail.
Check to make sure the consumer of the queue or subscription is active and receiving messages at a high enough rate.
The transaction is rolled back
No action is required
The limit of operations in a transaction has been reached
No action is required
No available waiter
No action is required

The key already exists in the table
No action is required
The waiter has been removed from the queue
No action is required
The waiter was not ready to receive the message
No action is required
There are no more entries in the store
No action is required
The waiter is enabled
No action is required
The requested topic name does not match the one cached locally for this thread.
No action is required
No message is available for the consumer
No action is required
A message was not returned but messages may be available
No action is required
Need to restart the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.
No action is required
An asynchronous request to stop a waiter was canceled
This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal informational message
No action is required
Operation would cause the thread to block
This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal informational message
No action is required
The transaction has already been heuristically committed
An attempt was made to commit or roll back a transaction that had already been heuristically committed
No action is required
The transaction has already been heuristically rolled back
An attempt was made to commit or roll back a transaction that had already been heuristically rolled back
No action is required
A delivery id is available to be assigned to a message
This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal informational message
No action is required
A client state was successfully created for an existing client id
This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal informational message
No action is required
The request succeeded but some destinations were full
A destination queue or subscription has reached its maximum messages but the requested operation succeeded.
Check to make sure the consumer of the queue or subscription is active and receiving messages at a high enough rate.
The retained message server timestamp is lower than the current for this topic
This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal condition.
No action is required.
Operations have been performed that need to be committed to the persistent store
This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal condition.
No action is required.
The end of the file being processed has been reached.
This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal condition.
No action is required.
The connection has completed normally.
The connection completed without error.
No action is required
The connection was closed by the client.
The server detected that the connection from the client was closed without a normal completion. This can occur when the client application terminates without sending a request to signal its intent to close the connection. It can also be caused by client or network failure.
No action is required
The connection was closed by the server.
The server has closed an outgoing connection without a normal completion. This can occur when the server closes an outgoing connection without sending a notification to signal its intent to close. It can also be caused by server or network failure.
No action is required
The connection was closed because the server was shutdown.
The connection was closed because the server is stopping.
No action is required
The connection was closed by an administrator.
The connection was closed because an administrator has disabled the endpoint or selected this connection to close.
No action is required
The connection was closed during a send operation.
The server detected that the connection from the client was closed without a normal completion. This can occur when the client application closes the connection without waiting to receive outstanding data from the server. It can also be caused by client or network failure.
No action is required
The connection was closed because it failed to acknowledge a message.
The server detected a client session that has failed to acknowledge delivery of a message. This can occur when the client is out of sync with the server. It can also be caused by client or network failure.
No action is required
System error
This error code is used by ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} components to indicate an error occurred while processing a request or function call.
See the previous log or trace output for more information. If the problem persists, contact IBM support.
Failure
This error code is used by ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} components to indicate that the component failed to process a request.
See the previous log or trace output for more information. If the problem persists, contact IBM support.
The function is not implemented
The caller or client requested a function that is not implemented by the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.
The caller or client needs to ensure that the function or feature is implemented by the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}. See the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} documentation for the information.
Unable to allocate memory.
The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} failed to allocate the memory.
Examine the system memory resource. Use system tools to profile memory usage for the entire process.
The server capacity is reached.
A possible cause is that the system resource is not available to use.
Inspect the system for other applications that are consuming excessive resources and stop them. Use system tools to profile memory and CPU usage for the entire process. As a last resort, you can restart the system.
The data from the client is not valid.
The data from the client that was received by the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is not valid. A possible cause is that the client request is out of order or that the request is not valid.
Ensure that the client established a valid connection to the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}. Ensure that the client requests are valid and in order.
The object is closed.
A possible cause is that the required internal object is already closed while the request is still in progress.
Ensure that the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is active and that the request from the client is in order.
The object is already destroyed.
A possible cause is that the required internal object is already destroyed while the request is still in progress.
Ensure that the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is active and that the request from the client is in order. See the previous log or trace output for more information.
A null object is not allowed.
The object that is required by the function is null.
Ensure that all the required objects are valid before calling the function.
The receive timed out.
A possible cause includes the client failed to communicate with the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} within the Keep Alive timer schedule. If the error is from the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} client (ISMC), this error indicated that the client did not receive any message from server within the timeout interval.
Check your networking environment to ensure that the client and server communication is active.
The lock could not be acquired.
This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.
Contact IBM support.
The property name is not valid: Property: {0}.
Possible causes could be that the property is either reserved or is not supported.
Ensure that the property is valid.
The property value is not valid: Property: {0} Value: {1}.
Possible causes could be that the value is the wrong type for the property or it is not in the valid range.
Ensure that the property value is valid.
The requested item is not found.
Possible causes could be that the requests from the client or caller are out of order, or that the requested object is not supported by the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.
Ensure that requests from the client are in order. In the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} command line environment, ensure that requested object is valid.
The messaging object is not valid.
Possible causes could be that the requests from the client or caller are out of order, or that the requested object is not supported by the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.
Ensure that requests from the client are in order. In the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} command line environment, ensure that requested object is valid.
An argument is not valid: Name: {0}.
There are several possible causes for this error.
For the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} administration interface, the requested action is not valid or the request is out of order.
For the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} command line interface (CLI), the argument from the command line request is not valid.
If the error code is from the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} client or server component, this is an internal error.
For the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} administration interface, ensure that the requested action is in order.
For the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} command line interface (CLI), ensure that the arguments are valid.
If the error code is from the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} client or server, contact IBM support.
A null argument is not allowed.
If the error is from the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} client or server, this is an internal error. Otherwise, the request from the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} command line interface contained the null argument.
Contact IBM support if the error is from the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} client or server. Otherwise, ensure that the arguments for the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} command line request are valid.
The message is not valid.
A possible cause is that the message header that was received by the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is not valid. If the error is from the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} client, this is an internal error.
Check your network configurations to ensure there are no other applications configured to use the same port. If the error is from the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} client, contact IBM support.
The properties are not valid.
There are several possible causes for this error.
The message header that was received by the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is not valid.
For the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} command line interface (CLI), the request contained properties that is not valid.
If the error is from the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} client, this is an internal error.
Check your network configurations to ensure there are no other applications configured to use the same port.
Ensure that the properties in the message header are valid.
Ensure that the properties for the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} command line interface are valid.
If the error is from the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} client, contact IBM support.
The client ID is not valid: {0}.
The client ID in the message is not valid.
Ensure that the client ID is valid. See the Java Messaging Service or MQTT specifications for more information.
The client ID is required and is not specified
The request from the client that was received by the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} does not contain the client ID.
Ensure that the client ID is in the request to the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.
The client ID is already in use: {0}.
A possible cause is that the client requested to create a connection with the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} and the client ID existed in the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.
Ensure that the client ID is valid. The client must disconnect from the server to create a connection with the same client ID.
The Unicode value is not valid.
A message that contains an invalid Unicode string was received by the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}. The invalid Unicode string might be, for example, the topic name, user name or MQTT will message.
Ensure that values such as topic name, user name and MQTT will message are valid and in Unicode.
The subscription name is not valid: {0}.
The subscription name is null or is not specified in the request to the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.
Ensure that the subscription name is valid.
The destination name is not valid: {0}.
The specified destination name is not valid. Possible causes are:
The specified destination name (queue or topic) is null or contains invalid characters.
The subscription with the specified name already exists for a different topic name.
Ensure that the destination name is valid.
The destination type is not valid.
The destination type is not valid for this operation. For example, retained messages cannot be published to a queue.
Ensure that the destination type is valid.
The destination is required and cannot be null
The destination name is null or empty.
Ensure that the destination name is a non-empty string.
The property type is not valid. Object: {0} Name: {1} Property: {2} Type: {3}
The property type is not valid.
Ensure that the property type is valid.
The name of a named configuration object is not valid: {0}.
There are several possible causes for this error.
The name is not a valid UTF-8 string.
The name contains trailing spaces.
The name is null.
Ensure that the name is valid.
The endpoint must be part of a message hub.
The endpoint message hub name does not match any available message hub.
Ensure that the endpoint message hub name is valid and matches an available message hub.
The monitoring data is not available because the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} status is not Running.
The status of ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is not Running. Any requests to retrieve monitoring data will be rejected.
Ensure that the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is active and the status is Running.
The client ID {0} is already associated with a different protocol: {1}.
A client ID which has been remembered, because durable resources are still owned by it, is associated with a protocol different to the protocol being requested.
To resolve this issue, try one of the following actions:
Modify the client ID specified by the application.
Delete the disconnected client state to remove the associated durable resources and allow the client ID to be used by a different protocol.
The property value is not valid. Object: {0} Name: {1} Property: {2} Value: {3}.
Possible causes could be that the value is the wrong type for the property or it is not in the valid range.
Ensure that the property value is valid.
The name of the configuration object is too long. Object: {0} Property: {1} Value: {2}.
The name of the configuration object has exceeded the maximum length.
Ensure that the name of the configuration object does not exceed the maximum length.
The value specified for the required property is invalid or null. Property: {0} Value: {1}.
The property value is invalid or null.
Ensure that the property value is valid.
The {0} value is an invalid regular expression.
The specified value is not a valid regular expression.
Ensure that the input value is a valid regular expression and try the operation again.
The item or object cannot be found. Type: {0} Name: {1}
Possible causes are that the requested object does not exist, or is not supported by the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.
Review the error message for more information.
The REST API call: {0} is not valid.
The REST API is not supported by the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.
Review the error message for more information.
The property name is invalid. Object: {0} Name: {1} Property: {2}
The property name is not valid.
Ensure that the property name is valid for the object type shown.
The object {0} must have one of the properties {1} specified
The object must have at least one of the properties listed with a non-empty value.
Ensure that at least one of the listed properties is specified with a non-empty value.
The object {0} is not valid.
The specified configuration object is not valid.
See the Reference section of the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} documentation in IBM Knowledge Center for more information.
The Object: {0} Name: {1} has been verified successfully.
The specified configuration object has been verified.
See the Reference section of the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} documentation in IBM Knowledge Center for more information.
{0} system call failed: The error is {1}({2}).
An error occurred when the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} attempted to use the specified system call.
Review the error message, correct the error and try the operation again. If the error persists, contact IBM support.
Invalid object configuration data is provided for the {0} object.
Invalid object configuration data is provided for the specified object or action.
Review the error message for more information.
The value that is specified for the property on the configuration object is too long. Object: {0} Property: {1} Value: {2}.
The length of the value of the configuration object has exceeded the maximum length.
Ensure that the length of the value of the configuration object does not exceed the maximum length.
The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} must be restarted to complete the configuration changes.
The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} must be restart using REST call.
Restart the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} using REST call.
The value that is specified for the property is too long. Property: {0} Value: {1}.
The length of the value of the configuration object has exceeded the maximum length.
Ensure that the length of the value of the configuration object does not exceed the maximum length.
A failure occurred while processing ILMT Tag file. License Type:{0} Version:{1}
The license acceptance process could not create ILMT tag file.
Contact IBM Support.
Could not find a matching inactive cluster member: ServerName:{0} ServerUID:{1}
Could not find a matching inactive cluster member.
Ensure that the cluster member specified by ServerName and ServerUID, is a member of a cluster and is not active.
The server state is not running in production mode.
The operation could not be completed because the server is not running in production mode.
Try the request again later or restart the server. See ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} documentation for further information.
Unable to connect.
The ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} client failed to connect to the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}. Possible causes could be that the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is not active, or that the server IP address is not valid.
Check your network settings.
Ensure that the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is active.
Ensure that the server IP address is valid.
Unknown host.
Possible causes could be that the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is not active, or that the server IP address is not valid.
Check your network settings.
Ensure that the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is active.
Ensure that the server IP address is valid.
The connection is not open.
There are several possible causes for this error:
The session is not valid.
Authentication failed.
The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} rejected the request.
Ensure that the session is valid.
Ensure that security information such as user ID, password, and SSL certificate is valid.
See the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} log for more information.
There was a networking error when data was being sent or received.
${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} encountered internal networking errors.
Ensure that the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is running. If the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is running and the problem persists, contact IBM Support.
Too many producers and consumers in a single connection.
The number of producers and consumers in a single connection exceeds the maximum allowed.
For MQTT the maximum number of subscriptions in a connection is 500.
For JMS the maximium number of consumers in a connection is 1000.
Reduce the number of producers and consumers in a single connection.
The port is in use.
The ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} client or server failed to bind with the specified port because the port is in use.
Ensure that the specified port is not in use by other applications.
Unable to create the endpoint socket.
The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} failed to create the endpoint socket.
See the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} log for more information. See the platform documentation for more information.
The port is not valid. The port must be between 1 and 65535.
The specified port is not valid.
Ensure that the port number is between 1 and 65535. See the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} log for more information.
The IP address is not valid.
The specified IP address is not a valid interface on this server.
Ensure that the interface is either the numeric IP address of one of the interfaces on this server, or can be resolved to one of the intefaces on this server.
The connection is not authorized.
The connection did not complete because it is not authorized on this server.
Ensure that the the application has sufficient authority to connect.
The connection timed out.
The connection was inactive for the configured period of time and is now closed. This commonly indicates that the client has terminated or that the network has failed without the server being notified.
Check why the client application did not respond.
Failed to ping client.
The connection failed when trying to ping the client.
Check why the client application in non-responsive.
The client did not respond to a ping.
The client was contacted but no response was received. This normally indicates that either the client application or the network has failed.
Check why the client application in non-responsive.
Closed during TLS handshake.
The connection was closed during a TLS (Transport Layer Security) handshake.
Check why the client application in non-responsive.
No data was received on a connection.
No data was received on a connection after the connection was created. This normally indicates a large delay in the network, but can be a symptom of a denial of service attack.
If there are a large number of these disconnects, check whether the network has a problem or if there is a denial of service attack on the server.
The initial packet is too large.
The packet size of the initial data packet is too large. The size of the first packet is restricted because the packet is sent before authorization. This error can be a symptom of a denial of service attack.
If there are a large number of these disconnects, check whether the network has a problem or whether there is a denial of service attack on the server.
The ClientID is not valid.
The client identifier is not correct for this protocol.
Ensure that any client identifier used is valid.
Server not available.
A connection to the requested server cannot be made at this time.
Retry the connection later, or validate that the configuration for the server is correct.
Messaging is not available.
The messaging engine on the requested server is not available at this time. This could indicate the the server is in the process of restarting.
Retry the connection later, or ensure that the server is correctly configured.
Certificate missing.
The endpoint is configured to require a client certificate and the client did not present a certificate.
Ensure that the client has a certificate available when connecting to an endpoint that requires certificates.
Certificate not valid.
The endpoint is configured to require a client certificate and the client presented a certificate that could not be validated by the server.
Ensure that the client has a certificate that is valid, and that the server has all necessary certificate authorities to validate the client certificate.
HTTP handshake failed.
The client presented an HTTP handshake with errors. This could be an invalid WebSockets header. The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} does not handle HTTP headers other than WebSockets.
Ensure that the client is sending a valid WebSockets header.
Unable to remove message ID at server.
The server is unable to remove a message ID at the server. This will leave a state mismatch between the client and the server.
Ensure that the client and the server state match.
Too many connections for a tenant.
The maximum number of connections allowed for a tenant was exceeded.
Ensure that no more than the allowed number of clients connect simultaneously, or increase number of connections allowed for a tenant.
The client set specification is not valid.
The specified client set value is not a valid regular expression.
Ensure that the client set value is a valid regular expression and try the operation again.
The HTTP Authorization header cannot be changed in a connection.
The HTTP Authorization header is checked for the first complete header in a connection. Subsequently, it cannot be changed. If you need to change the authorization, you must make a new connection.
Do not change the HTTP Authorization header in a connection.
Authentication request is in delay or too many authentication requests.
There are multiple authentication requests from a client with the same client ID which received by the server, and there is an authentication request in progress.
Ensure that the client submit the CONNECT the request and wait for reply. Ensure that each client have unique client ID.
Failed to create device.
Failed to create the device due to errors.
Ensure that the device configuration is correct.
The operation is not authorized.
The operation is not on the list of authorized operations in the security profile.
Ensure that security profile is configured appropriately.
User authentication failed.
The user failed to authenticate with the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.
Ensure that the user has appropriate permissions.
LTPA token has expired.
The client connection is closed because the token used to authenticate the client has expired.
The client application should get a new token and reconnect. Consider changing the expiration time for the server that issues the tokens.
OAuth token is not valid.
The client connection is closed because the OAuth authorization token used to authenticate the client is either NULL or not valid. The OAuth authorization token is a JSON object that includes access_token, expires_in and refresh_token fields.
The client application should get a new token and reconnect.
The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} could not connect to the OAuth authorization server. The cURL return code is {0}.
The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} could not connect to the OAuth authorization server.
Check the error code in the message to determine the problem.
The security profile must be set if security is enabled.
Possible causes are that the name of the security profile is not valid, or that the name does not match any of the security profiles.
Ensure that the name is valid.
The certificate profile must be set if TLSEnabled is true.
Possible causes are that the name of the certificate profile specified is not valid, or that the name does not match any of the certificate profiles.
Ensure that the name of the certificate profile is valid.
Unable to create the TLS context.
Possible causes include:
The certificate file does not exist, or you do not have permission to read that file.
The type of the certificate file is not valid.
If private key is used, the private key does not match the corresponding public key in the certificate.
The type of the private key file is not valid.
The private key file does not exist, or you do not have permission to read that file.
The private key file is not in right format.
If the private key file is encrypted, the password is not correct or no password was provided.
The public key in the certificate does not match the corresponding private key in the private key file.
Ensure that the certificate file and private key file is valid and configured with appropriate permissions.
Authorization service unavailable.
The call to the authentication service resulted in an internal error.
Ensure that the authentication service is available and operating normaly.
The security context is not valid.
This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.
Contact IBM Support.
LTPA key file is not valid or missing, or the key file and password do not match.
Possible causes include:
The key file is not created and exported from IBM Websphere Application Server or IBM Worklight Server.
The key file is corrupted.
The key file and the password do not match.
Ensure that the specified password is a valid password, and the LTPA key file is created and exported from IBM Websphere Application Server or IBM Worklight Server.
Failed to decode LTPA key or token.
Possible causes include:
The key file is not created and exported from IBM Websphere Application Server or IBM Worklight Server.
The file is corrupt.
Ensure that the LTPA key file is created and exported from IBM Websphere Application Server or IBM Worklight Server.
Failed to decrypt LTPA key or token.
Possible causes include:
The specified password to decrypt the key file is not valid.
The key file is not created and exported from IBM Websphere Application Server or IBM Worklight Server.
The file is corrupt.
Ensure that the specified password is a valid password, and that the LTPA key file is created and exported from IBM Websphere Application Server or IBM Worklight Server.
The connection has expired.
The client connection is closed because the token used to authenticate the client has expired.
The client application must get a new token and reconnect. Consider changing the expiration time for the server that issues the tokens.
LTPA private or public key is not valid.
The private or public key in the LTPA key file is not valid.
Ensure that LTPA key file used in LTPAProfile is valid.
Failed to generate LTPA token signature.
Authentication function could not create a digital signature from the LTPA token data. The LTPA token might be corrupted.
Ensure that the client application is connecting with valid LTPA token.
Failed to verify LTPA token signature.
The authentication function could not verify the digital signature in LTPA token data.
Ensure that the client application is connecting with valid LTPA token.
Low-level SSL call failed during LTPA key file or token processing.
Low-level SSL call failed during LTPA key file or token processing.
Restart the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}. If the problem persists, contact IBM support.
A variable specified in the policy is not valid. The variable must end with a closing brace ( } ).
A variable specified in the policy is not valid. The variable must end with a closing brace ( } ).
Ensure that the specified destination or filter in the policy has a well-formed and valid variable substitution. Check the imaserver-admin.log entry for more information.
An unknown variable is specified in the policy.
An unknown variable is specified in the policy.
Ensure that the specified destination or filter in the policy has a valid variable substitution. Check the imaserver-admin.log entry for more information.
A request is already in progress.
Possible causes include:
The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is in the process of stopping the message delivery.
The client request is out of order.
Ensure that the request to the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} from the client is in order.
The waiter has been initialized already.
This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.
Contact IBM support.
The waiter is not initialized.
This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.
Contact IBM support.
The queue has been deleted already.
This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.
Contact IBM support.
The transaction is associated with another session.
This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.
Contact IBM support.
An invalid parameter was supplied.
This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.
Contact IBM support.
A request was rejected as it is currently invalid.
This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.
Contact IBM support.
The destination still holds messages.
This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.
Contact IBM support.
The destination has too many existing consumers.
This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.
Contact IBM support.
The sending of messages to this destination is not allowed.
This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.
Contact IBM support.
The subscription name being requested already exists.
This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.
Contact IBM support.
The client ID is in use by an active connection.

If you need to prevent this from happening, ensure that MQTT connections use different client IDs.
The topic cannot be used because it is a system topic.
Topic names starting with $SYS are system topics. System topics can only be published by the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}. You are not allowed to create a durable subscription to system topics.
If you do not mean to use a system topic, then use a topic name that does not start with $SYS. If you are subscribing to a system topic, you must not use a durable subscription. In MQTT you must subscribe to a system topic in a connection created with cleansession=1.
The consumer must have a matching share with the existing subscription.
The subscription cannot be modified because the specified change is not permitted. Shared subscriptions cannot be modified and non-shared subscriptions cannot be changed to shared subscriptions.
Ensure that only valid subscription changes are made by client applications.
The requested quality of service is not allowed.
The request to subscribe or publish at the specified quality of service (QoS) is not allowed.
Ensure that the application specifies only a permitted quality of service.
A cleansession=0 session is not allowed.
The connection is not allowed to make a durable session connection. In MQTT a durable session connection is one where the CleanSession bit is set to 0.
Ensure that the application only requests a durable session if it is allowed to do so.
The version of the protocol is not supported.
A new connection request specified a known protocol, but the version of the protocol is either not known or not supported.
Ensure that the client uses one of the supported protocols. See ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} documentation for details.
Too much data was received before authentication was complete.
Some protocols such as MQTT allow data to be send on a connection before authentication is complete. The amount of such data is limited to prevent a denial of service attack.
Ensure that only small amounts of data are sent on a connection before it is authenticated. Do not send large amounts of data on a connection until the response from the connection packet is received.
The packet type must be binary.
The WebSockets packet type must be binary to send data which is not valid UTF-8 encoded text. All MQTT packets must be sent as binary packets.
Ensure that the client sending the WebSockets data is using binary packet type when sending binary data.
There are no subscriptions.
This is an internal ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} condition.
No action is required.
The protocol is not correct.
The connection is closed because the protocol received by the server does not conform to the specification. The wire format is correctly encoded but violates one of the constraints.
Fix the data sent by the client and retry.
The topic alias is not valid.
The connection is closed because the protocol received by the server contains a topic alias with is not valid. The topic alias must be between 1 and the max topic alias value specified by the server.
Fix the data sent by the client and retry.
Too many persistent messages are in process.
The connection is closed because the MQTT flow control for messages of QoS>0 has been exceeded. The server tells the client the maximum number of messages which can be in process. A message is in process from when the publish is received until the ACK is sent.
Fix the data sent by the client and retry.

The amount of available system memory in the virtual ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is insufficient.
${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} has detected that available system memory is not sufficient, preventing it from starting properly.
Refer to the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} documentation for details on virtual appliance configuration.
More than one error is detected in the virtual ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}. Check the imaserver-admin.log file for details.
${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} has detected problems with configured virtual CPUs or disk size, preventing it from starting properly.
Refer to the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} documentation for details on virtual appliance configuration.
A failure occurred when the LicensedUsage configuration value was being updated.
An error occurred when an update to the LicensedUsage configuration was being processed. This error might be caused by transient system problems.
Retry the command. If the problem persists, contact IBM Support.
A failure occurred when the LicensedUsage status was being updated.
An error occurred when the LicensedUsage status was being updated. This error might be caused by transient system problems.
Retry the command. If the problem persists, contact IBM Support.
The HTTP request is not valid.
The HTTP request that was sent to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is not valid. This can be due to a number of problems and more information is provided in the Reason in the response.
Resolve the error in the HTTP request and resubmit it.
The HTTP request is not authorized.
The HTTP request that was sent to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} does not contain an Authorization header, or the Authorization header is not valid. The HTTP request can be resubmitted with a valid Authorization header. This is commonly done by browsers using a dialog to ask for user name and password. Browsers commonly remember a previously specified user name and password, so if these change, it might be necessary to restart the browser to clear this cache.
Add an Authorization header with a user name and password and resubmit the request. This is commonly done in browsers by setting user name and password in a challenge dialog. If you are using curl, add a -u option.
The HTTP request is for an object which does not exist.
The HTTP request that was sent to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is for an object that does not exist. This can be caused by incorrect spelling in the path specified on the request. The path is case sensitive so make sure that objects are specified in the correct case.
Ensure that the request specifies an existing object and resubmit it.
The HTTP request with unsupported content type.
The the entity of the HTTP request that was sent to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is not in a supported format. This can be caused by client sending data in a format that is not supported by.
Ensure that the request entity is of supported format and resubmit it.

To delete the SecurityProfile, remove it from all the endpoints using it and try the operation again.

The LDAP URL is not valid.
A possible cause is that the LDAP URL or host name in the URL is null, or not valid.
Ensure that the LDAP URL is valid.
Failed to bind with the LDAP server: {0}. The error code is {1}.
Possible causes are:
The BindDN or BindPassword is not valid.

The LDAP configuration is not valid.

The certificate for LDAP is not valid or does not exist.
The certificate for external LDAP configuration is not valid.
Ensure that the LDAP configuration is valid.
Ensure that the certificate is valid.
The CertificateProfile was not found.
The certificate profile does not exist.
Ensure that the name of the certificate profile is valid.
The specified certificate is in use.
The certificate cannot be assigned to the CertificateProfile because it is already assigned to a different CertificateProfile.
Ensure that the certificate is valid and assigned to only one CertificateProfile.
The specified key file is in use.
The key cannot be assigned to the CertificateProfile because it is already assigned to a different CertificateProfile.
Ensure that the key is valid and assigned to only one CertificateProfile.
Configuration error.
This error code is used by ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} components to indicate an error occurred while processing a configuration object.
See the previous log for more information. If the problem persists, contact IBM Support.
LTPAProfile is in use.
The LTPAProfile is in use by one or more SecurityProfile(s). It can not be deleted unless all the SecurityProfile(s) stop using it.
To delete the LTPAProfile, update all the SecurityProfile(s) using it with alternative LTPAProfile(s) and try the operation again.
LTPAProfile is not found.
The LTPAProfile that is specified by the SecurityProfile was not found.
Make sure that an existing LTPAProfile is specified and try the operation again.
UseClientCertificate is enabled in the SecurityProfile. A Trusted Certificate or a Client Certificate must be associated with the SecurityProfile.
A TrustedCertificate or a Client Certificate must be associated with the SecurityProfile.
Upload a TrustedCertificate or a Client Certificate, and associate the certificate with the SecurityProfile.
Failed to obtain the LDAP distinguished name.
Possible causes are:
${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} failed to connect with the LDAP server.
The LDAP entry does not exist for the user or group.
Ensure that the LDAP configuration is valid. Ensure that the user or group name is valid.
OAuthProfile is in use.
The OAuthProfile is in use by one or more SecurityProfile(s). It can not be deleted unless all the SecurityProfile(s) stop using it.
If the OAuthProfile has to be deleted, update all the SecurityProfile(s) using it with the other OAuthProfile(s) and try the operation again.
OAuthProfile is not found.
The OAuthProfile that is specified by the SecurityProfile is not found.
Make sure that an existing OAuthProfile is specified and try the operation again.
The certificate {0} and key file {1} do not match.
The certificate and the key file that are specified do not match.
Ensure that the certificate and key file match and try the operation again.
The HTTP DELETE request failed to delete configuration object: {0}, delete string: {1}.
The HTTP DELETE request failed.
Retry the command. If the problem persists, contact IBM Support.
A secured ResourceURL or UserInfoURL is specified. You must also specify KeyFileName.
The https is specified in a ResourceURL or UserInfoURL configuration item, but the OAuth server certificate is not confiured.
Ensure that the OAuth server certificate is configured using a KeyFileName configuration item.
Syslog connectivity cannot be disabled.
Syslog connectivity cannot be disabled, because it is currently being used by one or more logs.
Ensure that all logs are file-based and retry the command.
The LDAP search failed for BaseDN: {0}. The LDAP error is {1}.

Ensure that the BaseDN value is valid.
The PreSharedKey file is not valid.
The PreSharedKey file is not valid.
Ensure that the PreSharedKey file is valid.
Store is not available.
A possible cause is that the store was not started properly or is locked by another ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} process.
Ensure that there is no other ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} process running and try to restart the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}. If the problem persists, contact IBM support.
Store data is unrecoverable.
A possible cause is that the store was created by a standby node that was not terminated properly.
Either clean the store and restart the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}, or use the node as a standby in an HA-Pair.
Store generation is full.
This is an internal ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} warning.
No action is required.
Store is full.
The ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} store component is full.
Try to restart the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}. If the problem persists, try to disconnect some of the clients that are connected to the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.
Store is busy.
A possible cause is that the store did not stop properly.
Try to force stop the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}. If the problem persists, contact IBM support.
Store transaction is active.
This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal warning.
No action is required.
Store disk error.
A possible cause is that the storage subsystem used by the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} failed or is not supported.
Contact IBM support.
Store memory allocation error.
This is an internal ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} warning.
No action is required.
Buffer length is too small.
This is an internal ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} warning.
No action is required.
Store High-Availability error.
The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is configured with high availability enabled but encountered a problem when trying to start in high availability mode.
Check that high availability is configured properly. Check the log for the description of the problem that was encountered.
An HA configuration parameter is not valid: parameter name={0} value={1}.
The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is configured with high availability enabled and one of the high availability parameters is incorrect.
Check the high availability configuration parameters. Make sure that the IP addresses provide in the configuration are correct.
Discovery time expired. Failed to communicate with the other node in the HA-pair.
Possible causes include:
The other node of the high availability pair is down.
The nodes are not configured properly.
Network error.
Ensure that both nodes of the high availability pair are started and can communicate with each other.
Ensure that the high availability configuration is correct. Both nodes must have the same Group and, if HA NICs are defined, they must have the correct IP addresses.
If the problem is not resolved, try to use manual HA configuration (define LocalDiscoveryNIC, LocalReplicationNIC, and RemoteDiscoveryNIC) to establish the HA-Pair.
Two primary nodes have been identified (split-brain).
Two primary nodes have been identified (split-brain). The node should be terminated.
Select a node that should start as a standby node, clean the store on that node and restart both nodes.
Two unsynchronized nodes have been identified. Unable to resolve which store should be used.
Two unsynchronized nodes have been identified, both nodes can not act as primary nodes. The nodes should be terminated.
Clean the store on both nodes and restart both nodes.
The two nodes have non-empty stores on startup.
Unable to resolve which node should be used as the primary.
Select a node that should start as standby node, clean the store on that node and restart the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.
The HA NIC {0} is not configured properly and cannot be used.
The node was unable to start in high availability mode because one of the HA NICs is not configured properly and cannot be used.
Ensure that the high availability configuration is correct.
Make sure that the HA network interfaces ha0 and ha1 are both up, are assigned valid IP addresses, and are properly connected.
If IP addresses are assigned to the HA NICs (LocalDiscoveryNIC, LocalReplicationNIC, and RemoteDiscoveryNIC) make sure that the IP addresses are correct.
Store version conflict.
The current store version is newer than the firmware version. The store cannot be recovered by the current firmware.
Upgrade the firmware to the latest version, or clean the store and restart the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.
The store owner objects limit has been exceeded.
The store is becoming full and as a result, the creation of a new owner object in the store failed.
Avoid creating new owner objects including subscriptions, clients and queues. Consider reducing the load on the store by removing clients, subscriptions and queues from the server.
A failure occurred when SNMP configuration data was being saved.
A failure occured when updated configuration data was being written to the SNMP configuration file. The file might be corrupted as a result of this failure.
Contact IBM Support.
A failure occurred when SNMP configuration data was being parsed.
An error occurred when SNMP configuration data was being processed. This error might be caused by transient system problems or it might indicate a problem in the configuration data.
Retry the command. Contact IBM Support if the problem persists.
A failure occurred when SNMP configuration data was being read.
An error occurred when SNMP configuration data was being read. This error might be caused by transient system problems.
Retry the command. Contact IBM Support if the problem persists.
As a result of an internal error, no SNMP configuration information was obtained.
An internal error prevented retrieval of SNMP configuration data.
Retry the command. Contact IBM Support if the problem persists.
A failure occurred when the value for SNMPEnabled was being retrieved.
The status of the SNMP service could not be retrieved.
Retry the command. Contact IBM Support if the problem persists.
Community {0} was not created because the community already exists.
An attempt was made to create an SNMP community with a community name that is already in use by another community.
Retry the command but ensure that you specify a community name that is not already in use.
Community {0} was not deleted because the community is in use by one or more trap subscribers.
The SNMP community was not deleted because the SNMP community is in use by one or more trap subscribers.
Delete all trap subscribers associated with the SNMP community before attempting to delete the SNMP community.
Community {0} was not deleted because the community does not exist.
The deletion failed because no SNMP community with the specified name name was found.
No action is required if the community had been previously deleted. If the community had not been previously deleted, verify that the spelling and case for the community name are correct and retry the command.
The trap subscriber was not created because a trap subscriber already exists for the host {0}.
A trap subscriber already exists for the specfied host.
Retry the command but ensure that you specify a host that is not already in use by a trap subscriber.
A community was not created because no configuration data was provided.
No input was provided to the request to create an SNMP community.
Retry the command with the required input data. A community name must be provided; host restriction data is optional.
The community was not created because the community name was not provided.
Creation of an SNMP community failed because the community name was not specified.
Retry the command with the required input data. A community name must be provided; host restriction data is optional.
The configuration change succeeded but the SNMP service was not restarted after the configuration was changed.
The SNMP service is restarted only if it was enabled when the configuration was updated. This failure can occur because the status of the SNMP service could not be retrieved or because an error occurred when the service was restarted.
To run the service with the updated configuration, stop it by setting SNMPEnabled to false and then restart it by setting SNMPEnabled to true.
A community was not deleted because no configuration data was provided or the value for the community name was an empty string.
Required input data was not provided for the request to delete an SNMP community. A community name must be specified.
Retry the command with the required input data.
The SNMP configuration change failed due to an internal error.
An attempt to add or delete an SNMP community or trap subscriber failed, or to get or set SNMPEnabled, failed due to an internal error.
Retry the command. Contact IBM support if the problem persists.
The trap subscriber was not created because required configuration data was not provided. When creating a trap subscriber, a host, a client port and a community must be specified.
The creation of an SNMP trap subscriber failed because one or more of the required input values was missing or was an empty string. A host, a client port number, and a community must be specified.
Retry the command with all required input data.
The trap subscriber was not created because the community {0} does not exist.
When creating a trap subscriber, specify an SNMP community that already exists.
Ensure that the community for the trap subscriber exists and that the spelling and case for the community name that is used to create the trap subscriber matches the existing SNMP community name value.
A trap subscriber was not deleted because no configuration data was provided or the value for host was an empty string.
Required input data was not provided for the request to delete an SNMP trap subscriber. A host value must be specified.
Retry the command with the required input data.
The trap subscriber was not deleted because a trap subscriber for host {0} does not exist.
No trap subscribers exist for the host that was specified.
No action is required if the trap subscriber had been previously deleted. If the trap subscriber had not been previously deleted, retry the command ensuring that the correct host name or IP address is specified.
A trap subscriber was not created because no configuration data was provided.
No input was provided to the request to create an SNMP trap subscriber. A host, a client port number, and a community must be specified.
Retry the command with all required input data.
An SNMP configuration request failed because the configuration data was locked by another user.
The configuration was locked because another user was changing the SNMP configuration or was starting or stopping the SNMP service.
Retry the command.
The SNMP agent IP address {0} is not valid.
SNMP agent addresses must be valid, active ethernet interface addresses.
Ensure that the interface input value is the numeric IP address of one of the interfaces on this server.
The SNMP service is not enabled.
The value of the SNMPEnabled configuration object must first be set to true before you can start, stop, or restart the SNMP service.
Ensure that SNMPEnabled is true by using the REST API POST method in ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT}. For more information, see the Configuring SNMP section of the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} documentation in IBM Knowledge Center.
Cluster membership is disabled.
A cluster related operation was attempted while cluster membership is disabled.
If this server is intended to be a member of the cluster, enable cluster membership in server configuration and restart the server. If this server is not intended to be a member of a cluster, no action is required.
The cluster is not started or is not available.
A cluster-related operation was attempted while the server's cluster component was closed or did not start properly. This is an internal ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} error message.
Contact IBM Support. It may be possible to resume operation and connectivity with other cluster members by restarting the server.
The cluster array capacity is too small.
This is an internal ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} warning message.
No action is required.
Cluster internal error: {0}.
The server's cluster component encountered an unexpected internal error condition. The current server is disconnected from the cluster and is seen as inactive by other cluster members.
Restart the server and try the operation again. If the problem persists, contact IBM Support.
Cluster I/O error: {0}.
The ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} cluster component failed to read or write a file. This is an internal ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} error message.
Contact IBM Support.
The cluster stopped due to an internal error state.
The cluster component of ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is in an error state because it encountered an internal error condition and was forced to shut down. The current server is disconnected from the cluster and is seen as inactive by other cluster members.
Restart the server and try the operation again. If the problem persists, contact IBM Support.
The removal of a local server from the cluster timed out without acknowledgement from remote servers.
When a local cluster member leaves the cluster, it sends a leave message to the other cluster members and expects an acknowledgement in return. It is possibe not to receive an acknowledgement if the local server that is leaving the cluster has no connectivity with other servers. This might happen under one of the following conditions:
Other cluster members are inactive
Other cluster members are behind a network partition
The local server is the last one to be removed
If there are other cluster members, you can remove the local server from the cluster by issuing a 'remove remote server' request from one of the remaining cluster members. If the local server being removed is the last server in the cluster, no action is required.
An attempt to remove a remote server failed because the server is still active.
You cannot remove a remote server from the cluster while the server is still active. Only inactive remote cluster members can be removed from the cluster. This error has no effect on the operation of the local server.
Shut down the remote server that is to be removed from the cluster, and try again.
The removal of a local server from the cluster failed.
When a local cluster member leaves the cluster, it sends a leave message to the other cluster members and expects an acknowledgement in return. The operation might fail when the local server that is leaving the cluster has no connectivity with other servers. This may happen under one of the following conditions:
Other cluster members are inactive
Other cluster members are behind a network partition
The local server is the last one to be removed
The local server is shut down and is disconnected from the cluster, but might not be fully removed from the cluster. Some of cluster members may see the local server as inactive instead of removed.
If there are other cluster members, you can remove the local server from the cluster by issuing a 'remove remote server' request from one of the remaining cluster members. If the local server being removed is the last server in the cluster, no action is required.
A cluster bind error has occurred, and local address {0} cannot be assigned.
The cluster component of ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} could not bind to the network address specified for cluster control communication in the configuration.
Check the cluster configuration parameters. Ensure that the IP addresses specified in the configuration are correct.
A cluster bind error has occurred. Port {0} is busy.
The cluster component of ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} could not bind to the port specified for cluster control communication in the configuration. This might be caused by another process using the port that is specified in the configuration.
Check the cluster configuration parameters. Ensure that the cluster control ports specified in the configuration are correct. Check that there are no other processes using the assigned port; this might be another ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} process.
A cluster version conflict has occurred.
The local ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} attempted to communicate with another cluster member that is running an incompatible version of the software.
Check that all cluster members are running compatible versions of the software.
A cluster store version conflict has occurred.
The server's cluster component is trying to recover from a store that was created by a server running an incompatible version of the software.
Ensure that the current server's software version is compatible with the version in which the store was created. Contact IBM Support if the problem persists.
A cluster store ownership conflict has occurred.
The cluster component of ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is trying to recover from a store that was created by a different cluster member than the local server. This may be caused by recovering from a store backup produced by one cluster member and a configuration backup produced by another cluster member.
Ensure that the server is recovering from the correct and consistent store and configuration backup combination. If the problem persists, contact IBM Support.
Cluster configuration error: {0}.
One or more of the server's cluster related configuration parameters are not valid.
Check the cluster configuration parameters. If the error message does not refer directly to a documented configuration parameter, or if the problem persists, contact IBM Support.
The local server was previously removed from the cluster.
The cluster component of ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} detected that the local cluster member was previously removed from the cluster. This error can be caused by starting a cluster member that was removed from the cluster while it was down. Alternatively, this error can also be caused if the local cluster member was removed while it was behind a network partition, and the network partition subsequently healed. The removed server can no longer be part of the cluster.
Disable cluster membership on the server, then restart the server. After the server starts with cluster membership disabled, it is possible, if required, to re-enable cluster membership, and restart the server again. The server will re-join the cluster as a new cluster member with a new server UID (unique identifier). If the problem persists, contact IBM Support.
The local server discovered another server with the same server unique identifier (UID). The local server is restarted in maintenance mode when the error is detected.
The cluster component of ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} detected a remote cluster member with the same server UID as the local cluster member. To prevent two cluster members from having the same server UID, the local cluster member has been restarted in maintenance mode. The remote cluster member with the identical server UID is likely to continue. This error can be caused by the two members of an HA pair running as primary at the same time, perhaps due to a network partition.
Ensure that the server is configured with the correct cluster membership and HA combination, and restart the server. If the problem persists, contact IBM Support.
Start the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} ({0} {1}).
The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is starting.
No action is required.
Log entries lost due to delay in writing the log: count={0}
One or more messages could not be logged due to the backlog of messages waiting to be added to the log.
This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.
Start the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} Bridge ({0} {1}).
The ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} Bridge is starting.
No action is required.
The configuration file {0} is not found.
The specified configuration file is missing or cannot be read.
Verify that the specified file name is correct, and that the file at this location is readable.
Running in FIPS mode.
The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is running in FIPS mode.
No action is required.
Unable to establish FIPS mode: Error={0}.
The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} failed to initialize FIPS.
See the text in the error message for more information.
Unable to create a TLS context: Endpoint={0} Error={1}.
Possible causes include:
The certificate file does not exist or you do not have permission to read that file.
The file type is not valid.
If a private key is used, then the private key does not match the corresponding public key in the certificate.
The private key file does not exist or you do not have permission to read that file.
The private key file is not in the correct format.
If the private key file is encrypted, then the password is not correct or no password was provided.
The public key in that certificate does not match the corresponding private key in the private key file.
Ensure that the certificate and private key files are valid and configured with appropriate permissions.
Unable to create a client TLS context: Endpoint={0} Error={1}.
Possible causes include:
The certificate file does not exist or you do not have permission to read that file.
The file type is not valid.
If a private key is used, then the private key does not match the corresponding public key in the certificate.
The private key file does not exist or you do not have permission to read that file.
The private key file is not in the correct format.
If the private key file is encrypted, then the password is not correct or no password was provided.
The public key in that certificate does not match the corresponding private key in the private key file.
Ensure that the certificate and private key files are valid and configured with appropriate permissions.
File {0} was offloaded successfully.
Specified file was automatically transferred to a pre-configured location.
No action is required.
File {0} was offloaded successfully.
Specified file was automatically transferred to a pre-configured location.
No action is required.
The configuration file {0} cannot be read.
The specified configuration file cannot be read.
Validate that the name of the configuration file is correct and that the file is readable.
The configuration {0} is not valid JSON at line {2}.
The specified configuration file or REST content cannot be parsed as JSON.
Validate that file is valid JSON. Look at the specified line and the line before and after this one for errors.
The name of Forwarder {0} is not valid.
The specified name is not valid. The name of a Forwarder must be 1 to 32 bytes, valid UTF-8, and not contain control characters.
Update the bridge configuration with a valid Forwarder name.
The name of Connection {0} is not valid.
The specified name is not valid. The name of a Connection must be 1 to 32 bytes, valid UTF-8, and not contain control characters.
Update the bridge configuration with a valid Connection name.
The topic is not valid: Topic={0} ClientID={1} Connect={2} From={3} Reason={4}.
The specified topic is not valid for the reason shown.
Fix the topic so that it is valid.
The clientID is not valid: ClientID={0} Connect={1} From={2}.
The organization is not known: ClientID={0} Connect={1} From={2}.
The organization config is not valid: ClientID={0} Connect={1} From={2}.
A durable session is not allowed for this organization: ClientID={0} Connect={1} From={1}.
The Endpoint property is not known: Endpoint={0} Property={1}
The Endpoint definition contains a property which is not known and is ignored. This is commonly due to misspelling an endpoint property.
Fix or remove the endpoint property which is not valid.
ConnectionLogIgnore cannot resolve address: {0}
Unable to resolve the connection address: Connection={0} Address={1}
One of the addresses for a connection cannot be resolved to an IP address. This can indicate that the address is not spelled correctly, or that the specified address has no DNS entry mapping it to an IP address..
Fix or remove the connection address which is not valid.
ClientClass configuration error: ClientClass={0} Error={1} Code={2}
TopicRule configuration error: TopicRule={0} Error={1} Code={2}
ConectionLogIgnore is not set because the value is not valid: Error={0} Code={1}
The Tenant property is not known: Tenant={0} Property={1}
The specified configuration for a tenant contains an unknown property that is ignored.
Ensure that all entries in the tenant configuration are correctly specified.
An error was found configuring a tenant: Tenant={0} Error={1} Code={2}
The configuration for a tenant failed. If this is the creation of the tenant, the tenant configuration failed. If this is an update, the tenant could be left partially updated.
Ensure that all entries in the tenant configuration are correctly specified.
The Server property is not known: Server={0} Property={1}
